stories.text:
I have been using Firefox Developer Edition since 2018. As time goes on, I notice every UI change seems to be an imitation of Google Chrome. Most recently, the popups used for stuff like SSO.

I don't have a strong opinion on the changes, but I will say this, I had ZERO issue with how Firefox used to look.

Am I missing something here? Do most of you consider Google Chrome to be the state of the art for web browser UI/UX?
stories.title: Is Google Chrome's UI Superior to Firefox?

ISIS Afghanistan airport attacks: 60 civilians and 12 US service members killed

stories.text:
Hey everyone!

I recently came across ngx-rocket (https://ngx-rocket.github.io/home) which does a pretty good job at creating a fully functional Angular app with a a lot of the bootstrapping done for you.

Does anyone know if there is something similar for React and widely used like create-react-app (CRA)?

I've seen a --template option on CRA, but I've been unable to find a template gallery/library.

From what I gather, redux, redux-saga, axios, bootstrap, etc (to name a few) would be pretty standard frameworks to add.

Let me know what you've found!
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a create-react-app option that does as much as ngx-rocket?
